author: Kevin Melendez
title: Conmebol se rinde ante Alianza Lima tras eliminar a Gremio en la Copa Sudamericana: "¡Histórico!"
text:
Conmebol se rinde ante Alianza Lima tras eliminar a Gremio en la Copa Sudamericana: "¡Histórico!"
El equipo blanquiazul se llevó todas los aplausos tras coronar otra noche de gloria a nivel internacional. La cuenta oficial del torneo destacó el partidazo que los íntimos jugaron en Brasil.
Alianza Lima lo volvió a hacer. Tal como pasó a inicios de año ante Boca Juniors, por la Copa Libertadores el equipo íntimo se dio el lujo de eliminar a otro gigante del continente en su propia casa. Esta vez, la 'víctima' del equipo dirigido por 'Pipo' Gorosito fue Gremio de Porto Alegre, en Brasil, por la Copa Sudamericana.
Los blanquiazules, que habían ganado 2-0 en el partido de ida, sorprendieron al Tricolor Gaúcho plantándose bien ordenado en defensa. Aunque los locales se pusieron en ventaja, en el último minuto apareció Hernán Barcos para marcar el 1-1 definitivo y sellar la clasificación de su escuadra a octavos de final, hecho que fue resaltado por la propia Conmebol vía redes sociales.
PUEDES VER:
[El millonario premio que Alianza Lima ganó tras eliminar a Gremio y avanzar a octavos de final de Copa Sudamericana]
Conmebol felicitó a Alianza Lima por clasificar
"¡Empate e histórica clasificación! Alianza Lima sigue en camino en la Conmebol Sudamericana", se lee en la publicación realizada por la cuenta oficial del certamen. El resultado es uno de los más meritorios conseguidos por el elenco victoriano, pues de 21 visitas a tierras brasileñas hasta ahora, había perdido 20 y solo llegó a empatar en una ocasión.
Alianza Lima logró su segundo empate consecutivo en Brasil. Foto: captura de Conmebol Sudamericana/X
A nivel individual, Barcos y el portero Guillermo Viscarra también fueron destacados por su acciones claves durante el encuentro. El 'Pirata' convirtió el tanto que decretó el empate, mientras que el golero se lució con una atajadón a Martin Braithwaite para evitar el 2-0 que hubiera llevado la serie a los penales.
PUEDES VER:
[Alianza Lima se interesa en jugador señalado en purga de Sporting Cristal: las condiciones para lograr su fichaje]
¿Cuál es el próximo rival de Alianza Lima?
Ahora, Alianza Lima se medirá a la Universidad Católica de Ecuador en la ronda de octavos de final. Los íntimos deberán tener cuidad del Trencito Azul, que fue uno de los mejores equipos en la fase de grupos al terminar invicto y líder, con 14 puntos.

author: Shelby Valicenti
title: Following strong start to the season, Colorado’s snowpack risks dropping below normal if incoming storms don’t deliver
text:
An early season surge in Colorado’s snowpack has dramatically slowed amid a prolonged dry spell . If incoming storms over the next week don’t deliver, experts say snowpack levels could drop below normal.
Snowpack is tracked by looking at the snow-water equivalent, a measurement that shows how much liquid water is held within the state’s snowfields.
Following its progress through the winter and spring helps provide insight into the strength of the season’s runoff and what it means for the health of the state’s reservoirs and drought conditions.
“It means having a good water supply for the year or several years … Secondly, it can be a measure of how prone we are for wildfires the following year,” said National Weather Service meteorologist Dave Barjenbruch. “If we have a poor snowpack, that’s likely going to add more stress for trees and soil as we head into the summer.”
Snowpack levels have climbed for much of the early season, aided by a routine cycle of heavy storms that helped ski areas open terrain at an accelerated pace. That changed at the end of November when conditions dried and snowpack levels flatlined across the state.
As of Thursday, Dec. 12, statewide snowpack stood at 105% of the 30-year median. In the Colorado Headwaters River Basin, which encompasses the bulk of the state’s ski resorts, levels were slightly higher at 108%, according to data from the Natural Resources Conservation Service .
The region with the greatest snowpack remains the Arkansas River Basin in south-central Colorado, where levels stood at 144% and set a new seasonal record last month.
The black line shows snowpack trends for the current winter season compared to the 30-year-median, shown in the green line. After major back-to-back storms during the week of Thanksgiving, Colorado’s snowpack has flattened amid mostly dry conditions. Natural Resources Conservation Service/Courtesy illustration Following a brief bump at the beginning of this week, snowpack levels could remain mostly flat through Christmas and could even begin to approach historical lows, according to a projection by OpenSnow founding meteorologist Joel Gratz.
“Our snowpack will stay at about the same number due to cool air and a low sun angle, or perhaps rise slightly due to upcoming weak storms,” Gratz wrote in a Wednesday blog post . “… However, our snowpack compared to the median will continue to decline during the next two weeks as we see little new snowfall and the median continues to increase.”
Hope for a resurgence is now riding on three projected storms, with the first set to hit during the day on Friday.
That storm is likely to favor the northern and central mountains with 1-5 inches of snow accumulation possible. On Sunday, snowfall is anticipated to resume during the late afternoon and into the evening and could again bring up to 5 inches of snow to northern and central mountain areas.
Snowfall may return again on Wednesday, Dec. 18, though Gratz wrote he currently has “low confidence” in this forecast.
“None of these three upcoming storms will bring significant snow, but little refreshes would be lovely,” Gratz wrote, adding that the longer-range forecast between now and Christmas will not be favorable.
“The 15-day snow forecast tells the story, with more snow along the West Coast and less snow here in Colorado through the Rockies,” Gratz said.
A forecast from the Climate Prediction Center shows an elevated chance for below-normal precipitation in Colorado between now and Christmas. “The 15-day snow forecast tells the story, with more snow along the West Coast and less snow here in Colorado through the Rockies,” said OpenSnow founding meteorologist Joel Gratz in a recent blog post. Climate Prediction Center/Courtesy illustration A 3-4 week outlook from the Climate Prediction Center shows equal chances for above- or below-normal precipitation in Colorado through early January, with as much as a 60% chance for above-normal temperatures .
Barjenbruch said it’s common for the state to see dry periods throughout the winter and it can take just one intense storm to bring snowpack levels back.
The recent surges in snowpack levels have been encouraging and will likely prove critical in the state’s ability to weather occasional bouts of dryer conditions, Barjenbruch said. The state is roughly a quarter of the way through its snowpack season, with over 100 days to go until levels reach the historical peak in April.
“The big storms are where you can really add on, say maybe an inch or two of water across the entire state’s snowpack, and that’s a huge benefit,” Barjenbruch said, adding January and February tend to bring some of the deepest snow storms to mountain regions.
“Those are the ones that really help out with building the snowpack and keeping our water resources available for the following years,” Barjenbruch said.

author: ObservadorUY
title: ¿Traición? Mary, la sobrina del expresidente Donald Trump, se une al equipo de Joe Biden en el debate
text: Esta noche, la sobrina del candidato a presidente de [Estados Unidos](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/us/tag/estados-unidos) [Donald Trump](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/us/tag/donald-trump), Mary Trump, se unirá al equipo [Biden](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/us/tag/biden)- [Harris](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/us/kamala-harris-a94884) en la sala de spinning, en el contexto del [debate que habrá en ](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/estados-unidos/politica/joe-biden/debate-joe-biden-vs-donald-trump-donde-se-hara-y-como-verlo-n5947234) [Atlanta](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/estados-unidos/politica/joe-biden/debate-joe-biden-vs-donald-trump-donde-se-hara-y-como-verlo-n5947234) [ entre Trump y el actual presidente estadounidense, ](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/estados-unidos/politica/joe-biden/debate-joe-biden-vs-donald-trump-donde-se-hara-y-como-verlo-n5947234) [Joe Biden](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/estados-unidos/politica/joe-biden/debate-joe-biden-vs-donald-trump-donde-se-hara-y-como-verlo-n5947234). ¿Traición? Mary, la sobrina del expresidente Donald Trump, se une al equipo de Joe Biden en el debate En una jugada inesperada, Mary, la sobrina del expresidente Donald Trump, se une al equipo de Joe Biden en el debate que habrá esta noche en Atlanta.

author: 徐昕昀
title: 我国成功发射巴基斯坦遥感卫星01星_天下_新闻频道_福州新闻网
text:
福州新闻网>>
新闻频道>>
天下
我国成功发射巴基斯坦遥感卫星01星
2025-07-31 11:18:27来源：新华社
新华社西昌7月31日电（李国利、崔婉莹）7月31日10时00分，我国在西昌卫星发射中心使用快舟一号甲运载火箭，成功将巴基斯坦遥感卫星01星发射升空，卫星顺利进入预定轨道，发射任务取得圆满成功。
巴基斯坦遥感卫星01星主要用于国土普查和防灾减灾领域。
【责任编辑：徐昕昀】
